message.content:
This question can be solved using simple logic, you don't need to do any calculations. Here's how:

Sally considers her two brothers as boys so they are not girls or sisters. We know that each of her brothers has 2 sisters but since we have already counted Sally (who is a sister to the brothers) twice, she doesn't count as a sister again when considering her brothers' sisters. Therefore, Sally has 1 sister in total.
